item.title: 早间竞价：关税言论笼罩市场，科技股拖累美指走低
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 比特币最后上涨 5.05%，报收于 96286 美元
item.description: 格林尼治标准时间周三 2130 时，比特币上涨 5.05% 至 96,286 美元，较前一交易日收盘价上涨 4,633 美元。【原文：Bitcoin rose 5.05% to $96,286 at 2130 GMT on Wednesday, adding $4,633 to its previous close.】

item.title: 微软面临范围广泛的美国反垄断调查
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周三透露，美国联邦贸易委员会已对微软展开了广泛的反垄断调查，包括其软件许可和云计算业务。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has opened a broad antitrust investigation into Microsoft , including of its software licensing and cloud computing businesses, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国劳工委员会法官裁定埃克森公司德克萨斯州炼油厂工会停工合法
item.description: 美国国家劳工关系委员会的一名行政法法官裁定，埃克森美孚公司在合同纠纷期间对德克萨斯州一家炼油厂约 600 名工会工人实施的长达 10 个月的停工是合法的。【原文：A U.S. National Labor Relations Board administrative law judge has ruled Exxon Mobil's 10-month-long lockout of some 600 union workers at a Texas oil refinery during a contract dispute was legal.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：美国联邦贸易委员会对微软展开广泛反垄断调查
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，美国联邦贸易委员会已对微软展开反垄断调查。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has opened an antitrust investigation of Microsoft , Bloomberg News reports on Wednesday.】

item.title: 谷歌要求美国上诉法院驳回应用商店垄断判决
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周三要求美国上诉法院撤销陪审团的裁决和法官迫使其整改应用程序商店 Play 的命令。【原文：Alphabet's Google asked a U.S. appeals court on Wednesday to throw out a jury verdict and a judge's order forcing it to revamp its app store Play.】

item.title: 微软否认利用用户数据训练人工智能模型
item.description: 微软（Microsoft）周三否认了其使用 Word 和 Excel 等 Microsoft 365 应用程序中的客户数据来训练人工智能模型的说法。【原文：Microsoft on Wednesday denied claims that it uses customer data from its Microsoft 365 applications, including Word and Excel, to train artificial intelligence models.】

item.title: 马斯克呼吁废除共和党人针对的消费者金融监督机构
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）被美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）委以削减政府成本的重任，他周三呼吁取消负责保护金融业消费者的联邦监管机构。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk, tasked with slashing government costs by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, on Wednesday called for the elimination of a federal regulatory agency charged with protecting consumers in the financial sector.】

item.title: 感恩节旅游开始创纪录
item.description: 数百万美国人将在感恩节前的周三挤进机场或上路，感恩节将成为一年中最繁忙的旅行日之一。【原文：Millions of Americans are set to crowd into airports or hit the road on the Wednesday ahead of Thanksgiving Day which is shaping up to be one of the busiest travel days of the year.】

item.title: 特朗普可能在关税攻势中求助于经过测试的贸易法工具
item.description: 人们普遍预计，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普将再次求助于他最喜欢的法律工具：《国际紧急状态经济权力法》（International Emergency Economic Powers Act），以支持他对墨西哥、加拿大和中国进口商品征收关税的威胁。【原文：U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is widely expected to again turn to a favorite legal tool to underpin threatened tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada and China: the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, one of several legal avenues to impose his broader tariff agenda.】

item.title: 聚焦：大型制药公司推动特朗普团队放宽医疗保险药品价格谈判规则
item.description: 据游说者、高管、分析师和医疗保健政策专家称，当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上任后，美国制药业正在推动修改允许医疗保险（Medicare）对其最昂贵的处方药进行价格谈判的新法律。【原文：The U.S. pharmaceutical industry is pushing to revamp the new law that allows Medicare to negotiate prices for its costliest prescription drugs once president-elect Donald Trump is back in office, according to lobbyists, executives, analysts and healthcare policy experts.】

item.title: 巴西 10 月份创造的正式就业机会低于预期
item.description: 巴西劳工部周三公布的数据显示，10月份巴西净创造了132714个正式工作岗位，低于路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查所预测的20万个。【原文：Brazil created a net 132,714 formal jobs in October, data from the labor ministry showed on Wednesday, below the 200,000 forecast in a Reuters poll of economists.】

item.title: 独家报道美国消费者金融监管机构在特朗普接管之前制定新规则
item.description: 三位熟悉美国消费者金融监督机构想法的人士表示，该机构正在乔-拜登（Joe Biden）领导的民主党政府任期的最后几周内推进规则制定工作，以期在当选总统特朗普全面改革该机构之前推进消费者保护工作。【原文：The U.S. consumer finance watchdog is moving ahead with rulemaking in the final weeks of Joe Biden's Democratic administration, in a bid to advance consumer protections before President-elect Trump overhauls the agency, said three people familiar with the agency's thinking.】

item.title: Orange 与 OpenAI 签订协议，获得预发布人工智能模型的使用权
item.description: Orange 集团首席人工智能官史蒂夫-贾雷特（Steve Jarrett）周三表示，Orange 已与欧洲 OpenAI 建立了多年合作关系，法国电信运营商将可以使用预发布的人工智能模型。【原文：Orange has struck a multi-year partnership with OpenAI in Europe that will give the French telecoms operator access to pre-release AI models, group chief artificial intelligence officer Steve Jarrett said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英国首相为谷歌支持的人工智能校园揭幕，激发学生灵感
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）周三为伦敦首个由谷歌资助的人工智能校园揭幕，该校园旨在帮助年轻人掌握这项快速发展的技术。【原文：British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Wednesday opened London's first Google-funded AI Campus which aims to help young people develop skills in the rapidly developing technology.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，埃克森游说者因黑客泄露环保人士电子邮件而被调查
item.description: 据三位熟悉内情的人士透露，联邦调查局一直在调查埃克森美孚公司的一位长期顾问，因为该承包商被指控在一次黑客泄密行动中扮演了重要角色，这次行动针对的是该石油公司数百名最大的批评者。【原文：The FBI has been investigating a longtime Exxon Mobil consultant over the contractor's alleged role in a hack-and-leak operation that targeted hundreds of the oil company’s biggest critics, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行的基金部门将排除新的石油和天然气债券
item.description: 法国巴黎银行资产管理公司（BNP Paribas Asset Management）11 月发布战略更新，将不再投资石油和天然气勘探与生产公司发行的新债券。【原文：BNP Paribas Asset Management will no longer invest in new bonds issued by companies involved in oil and gas exploration and production, according to a strategy update dated November.】

item.title: 受贸易紧张局势影响，2025 年全球股市将实现温和上涨
item.description: 路透社对股票分析师进行的一项调查显示，基于全球贸易紧张局势和通胀前景恶化阻碍股市上涨的前景，大多数主要股市甚至无法在 2025 年重复今年的低迷表现。【原文：Most major stock markets will fail to even repeat this year's lacklustre performance in 2025 based on the prospect of global trade tensions and a worsening inflation outlook holding back gains, according to a Reuters poll of equity analysts.】

item.title: VIEW 美国 10 月份 PCE 物价通胀率如期走高
item.description: 美国商务部周三表示，10月份个人消费支出（PCE）价格指数攀升0.2%，与9月份未经修正的涨幅持平。【原文：The personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index climbed 0.2% in October, the Commerce Department said on Wednesday, matching September's unrevised gain.】

item.title: 俄罗斯 VTB 称卢布下跌的背后是美国制裁
item.description: 俄罗斯第二大银行 VTB 的一位高管周三表示，美国对负责能源贸易的俄罗斯第三大银行 Gazprombank 实施的制裁是卢布最近几天自由下跌的原因。【原文：Sanctions imposed by the United States on Russia's third largest lender Gazprombank, which handles the energy trade, are behind the rouble's free fall in recent days, a top executive from VTB, Russia's second largest bank, said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统表示，如果美国先提高关税，墨西哥就会提高关税
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆周二表示，如果当选总统唐纳德-特朗普兑现其威胁，在上任后对墨西哥进口商品征收 25% 的关税，墨西哥将提高从美国进口的关税。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Tuesday that Mexico would raise tariffs on imports from the United States if President-elect Donald Trump follows through on his threat to issue a 25% tariff on Mexican imports after taking office.】

item.title: 美国 10 月消费支出稳健增长；通胀率保持高位
item.description: 美国消费者支出在 10 月份稳健增长，表明经济在第四季度初保持了强劲的增长步伐，但在过去几个月中，降低通胀的进展似乎停滞不前。【原文：U.S. consumer spending increased solidly in October, suggesting that the economy maintained its strong pace of growth early in the fourth quarter, but progress lowering inflation appears to have stalled in the past months.】

item.title: NAR 称美国成屋待售连续第三个月增长
item.description: 尽管抵押贷款利率居高不下，待售房产库存持续增加，健康的就业市场也为潜在买家的财务状况提供了保障，但 10 月份美国旧房购买合同出人意料地增加，连续第三个月实现增长。【原文：Contracts to buy U.S. previously owned homes rose unexpectedly in October, notching a third straight month of increases, despite high mortgage rates and as inventory of properties for sale continued to build and a healthy job market fortifies the finances of prospective buyers.】

item.title: Stellantis 将于 12 月停止意大利 Mirafiori 工厂的汽车生产
item.description: 斯特兰蒂斯汽车公司周三表示，将于12月2日至1月5日再次停止意大利米拉菲奥里工厂的汽车组装业务，该工厂生产电动菲亚特500和两款玛莎拉蒂跑车。【原文：Stellantis will halt again auto assembly operations at its Mirafiori plant in Italy, which makes the electric Fiat 500 and two Maserati sport car models, from Dec. 2 to Jan. 5, the automaker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Blackrock、State Street、Vanguard 因气候协议被共和党州起诉
item.description: 德克萨斯州和其他 10 个由共和党领导的州周三起诉机构投资者 Blackrock、State Street 和 Vanguard，指控他们通过气候激进主义违反了反垄断法，这些州称气候激进主义导致煤炭产量减少。【原文：Texas and 10 other Republican-led states sued institutional investors Blackrock , State Street and Vanguard on Wednesday, accusing them of violating antitrust law through climate activism that the states say led to diminished coal production.】

item.title: 美国零售商试图在更短的假日购物季中激发消费热情
item.description: 为了在 "黑色星期五 "吸引购物者，大型连锁零售商打算展示互动产品和体验，包括雷朋（Ray Ban）的增强现实眼镜、电子产品零售商百思买（Best Buy）的超大电视以及美国连锁百货公司诺德斯特龙（Nordstrom Inc.【原文：To entice shoppers on Black Friday, major retail chains intend to showcase interactive products and experiences, including Ray Ban augmented-reality glasses, extra-extra-large TVs at electronics retailer Best Buy and new spa services at U.S. department store chain Nordstrom Inc .】

item.title: 墨西哥警告特朗普关税将扼杀 40 万个美国就业机会
item.description: 墨西哥是美国最大的贸易伙伴。【原文：Mexico is the United States' top trade partner.】

item.title: 美国第三季度经济增长率未作修正，为 2.8
item.description: 美国政府周三证实，在消费者支出强劲的推动下，美国经济在第三季度实现了稳健增长。【原文：The U.S. economy grew at a solid clip in the third quarter, the government confirmed on Wednesday, amid robust consumer spending.】

item.title: 报告显示，11月美国汽车销量将在更大幅度的折扣中增长
item.description: 据行业咨询公司J.D. Power和GlobalData周三联合发布的报告称，受为清理库存而提高折扣的影响，预计11月份美国新车销量将同比增长6.7%。【原文：New vehicle sales in the U.S. are projected to have risen 6.7% in November from a year earlier, driven by higher discounts to clear elevated inventory, according to a joint report by industry consultants J.D. Power and GlobalData on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 10 月份核心资本货物订单意外下降
item.description: 10 月份，美国主要制造业资本货物的新订单出人意料地减少，表明本季度企业在设备方面的支出有所放缓。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods unexpectedly fell in October, suggesting a moderation in business spending on equipment this quarter.】
